score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi is performing moderately well, but there are some improvements needed to reduce random dropouts.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download improved, upload stayed the same, ping worsened, and networks increased.

latest_report.diagnosis: Your Wi-Fi network shows signs of congestion, particularly on the 2.4GHz band. This can cause the random dropouts you experience.

performance.interpretation: Current speeds are acceptable for your ISP plan and should support most online activities without issues.

problems: Congestion on the 2.4GHz band due to multiple overlapping networks.
Random dropouts likely caused by interference from nearby networks.
Underutilization of the 5GHz band which may offer cleaner channels.
fixes: Switch the 2.4GHz channel to 1 for stronger RSSI and less noise.
Change the 5GHz channel to 149 for a better signal with less congestion.
Consider relocating the router to a more central position in the home to reduce dropouts.
Enable Band Steering if you upgrade your router or ISP plan for optimal device management.
Limit background interference by turning off unused devices connected to the network.
